RECORD.TEXT: 608317547 ELMVH 13326739 4683681 4/18/2003 12:00:00 AM L3-L4 HERNIATED DISC Signed DIS Admission Date : 04/18/2003 Report Status : Signed Discharge Date : 04/26/2003 ADMITTING DIAGNOSIS : CENTRAL L3-L4 DISC HERNIATION , DEGENERATIVE DISC DISEASE L3-L4 , L4-L5 . ADMITTING SURGEON : Dr. Mammase Uph . ADMITTING HISTORY AND PHYSICAL : Ms. Guynlordsmantdouet is a 35-year-old female with incapacitating back pain starting 2 1/2 years ago after a motor vehicle accident . She had intermittent episodes of pain which were incapacitating for the past 2 1/2 years . She has tried a 50 pound weight loss , physical therapy , medications without any improvement . She has undergone several epidural steroid injections and three facet injections without any release in pain . She now presents for an elective decompression fusion . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Low back pain , depression , insomnia , adult attention deficit hyperactivity disorder . MEDICATIONS : OxyContin , Valium , Paxil , ibuprofen , calcium , potassium , multi-vitamins . ALLERGIES : Penicillin and codeine . PHYSICAL EXAM : GENERAL : Well dressed female in no apparent distress . HEART : Normal sinus rhythm . LUNGS : Clear to auscultation . NEURO : Gait is slow and guarded . There are no focal signs on exam . Difficult to demonstrate myotome secondary to pain . Reflexes appear to be grossly normal . Toes down going . No clonus . Sensory testing appeared grossly normal . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient presented to the hospital on April 18 , 2003 , and was taken to the operating room for a posterior spinal fusion from L3 to L5 using left iliac crest bone graft with instrumented fusion . Postoperatively she was transferred to the recovery room where her postoperative hematocrit was 24.7 and INR was 1.3 . She was transfused with one unit of packed red cells and one unit of FFP . Overnight she stayed in the PACU . Hemovac drain put out 1,000 cc overnight . Her hematocrit was checked again the following morning . It was 27 . She was transfused with another unit of blood . She was subsequently transferred to the Orthopedic Floor where Pain Service was consulted to manage her pain . They recommended starting a Dilaudid PCA . Physical therapy was also consulted for a Boston overlap brace and also for gait training and mobilization . Her diet was advanced as tolerated . She was slow to mobilize because of extreme pain . However , with the help of physical therapy she did move around and by postop day five she was ambulating and she otherwise progressed well . Her IV fluids were Hep locked after she was taking good POs . She was switched to oral pain medications . She otherwise progressed well and had an uncomplicated hospital stay . She was discharged in stable condition on April 25 , 2003 . At the time of discharge her incision was clean , dry , and intact and she was tolerating POs . DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : Flexeril 10 mg p.o. t.i.d. , Colace 100 mg p.o. b.i.d. , Oxycodone 15-20 mg p.o. q. 3-4 hours p.r.n. pain , OxyContin 16 mg p.o. q. 12 hours , Trazadone 50 mg p.o. q.h.s. , Paxil 30 mg p.o. q. day . DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS : 1. Wear brace whenever out of bed . 2. Keep incision clean and dry . 3. Follow up with Dr. Uph in the Orthopedic Clinic .
